triples.name: Phi coefficient
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using Matthews correlation coefficient (equivalent to phi coefficient in machine learning) as the preferred evaluation metric over accuracy and F1 score.

triples.name: Evaluation of binary classifiers
triples.relevance: The paper evaluates the performance of binary classification systems using different metrics.

triples.name: Confusion matrix
triples.relevance: The confusion matrix provides the foundation for calculating all evaluation metrics discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Accuracy and precision
triples.relevance: Accuracy is one of the main metrics compared against Matthews correlation coefficient in the paper.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: F1 score is the second primary metric that the paper argues is inferior to Matthews correlation coefficient.

triples.name: Binary classification
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on evaluating binary classification tasks, which is the core application domain.

triples.name: Accuracy paradox
triples.relevance: The accuracy paradox demonstrates the fundamental problem with accuracy metrics on imbalanced datasets that the paper addresses.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper is situated within the machine learning field where these evaluation metrics are essential tools.
